page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: {LANDSCAPE The eastern part of the school'sDomesday area has in its southern tip part of the Hempdykes.Further north there is FerryRoad, and Atkinson's Warren whichis crossed by a footpath going through from Crosby to the village of Flixborough.The Hempdykes were part of Crosby parish where springs emerged from a limestone ridge and ran down the slope.Linseed was grown and the water was used for washing the hemp. The land has now been drained and a housing estate with schools and shops has been built. Atkinson's Warren is named after Mr. W. Atkinson who lived in an isolated stone cottage on the warren manyyears ago.This became a breeding area for silver haired rabbits whose fur at one time was exported to Russia.
